org.cloudbus.cloudsim.geoweb.web

Class WebSession

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.cloudbus.cloudsim.geoweb.web.WebSession

  • public class WebSession
extends Object
    A web session is a session established between a user and an application server (deployed in a VM) and can use several database servers (deployed in separate VMs). Throughout it's lifetime a session continuously generates workload on the servers deployed in these virtual machines. The workload is represented as cloudlets, which are sent to the assigned servers.

    To achieve this a web session generates two consequent "streams" of cloudlets and directs them to the servers. These streams are based on two instances of IGenerator passed when constructing the session. The session takes care to synchronize the two generators, so that consequent cloudlets from the two generators are executed at the same pace. Thus if one of the servers is performing better than the other, this will not be reflected in a quicker exhaustion of its respective generator.

    Since the session utilizes IGenerator instances, which are unaware of the simulation time, it needs to notify them of how time changes. By design (to improve testability) web sessions are also unaware of simulation time. Thus they need to be notified by an external "clock entity" of the simulation time at a predefined period of time. This is done by the WebSession.notifyOfTime method.
    Author:
    nikolay.grozev

    • Constructor Detail

      • WebSession

        public WebSession(IGenerator<? extends WebCloudlet> appServerCloudLets,
                  IGenerator<? extends Collection<? extends WebCloudlet>> dbServerCloudLets,
                  int userId,
                  int numberOfCloudlets,
                  double idealEnd,
                  String... metadata)
        Creates a new instance with the specified cloudlet generators.
        Parameters:
        appServerCloudLets - - a generator for cloudlets for the application server. Must not be null.
        dbServerCloudLets - - a generator for cloudlets for the db server. Must not be null.
        userId - - the use id. A valid user id must be set either through a constructor or the set method, before this instance is used.
        metadata - - various metadata of the session.

    • Method Detail

      • getSourceIP

        public String getSourceIP()
        Returns the source IP of the session. If null - the source is unknown.
        Returns:
        the source IP of the session or null if unknown. The returned value is either null or a string in the standard dot form for IPv4 or IPv6 addresses.

        Parameters:

      • pollCloudlets

        public WebSession.StepCloudlets pollCloudlets(double currTime)
        Creates cloudlets to submit to the virtual machines. If at this time no cloudlets should be sent to the servers null is returned.
        Parameters:
        currTime - - the current time of the simulation.
        Returns:
        the result as described above.
